sen.j: 授翁宗弼（じゅおうそうひつ、1296年－1380年）は、鎌倉時代後期から南北朝時代 (日本)にかけての臨済宗の僧。
sen.e: Juo Sohitsu (1296 - 1380) was a Rinzai Sect Buddhist monk who lived from the latter part of the Kamakura period to the Northern and Southern Courts period.
Juo Sohitsu (1296 - 1380) was a Rinzai Sect Buddhist monk who lived from the latter part of the Kamakura period to the Northern and Southern Courts period.

sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist names were Enkan Kokushi and Mimyo Daishi.

sen.j: 後醍醐天皇に仕えながら大徳寺の宗峰妙超に参禅し、宗弼という法名を授かった。
sen.e: While in the service of Emperor Go-Daigo, he practiced Zen under Shuho Myocho of Daitoku-ji Temple and was granted the Buddhist name Sohitsu.

sen.j: 建武の新政の際には後醍醐天皇をいさめたが受け入れられず、ひそかに洛北岩倉で不二大徳に支持して得度した。
sen.e: He warned Emperor Go-Daigo during the Kemmu Restoration but these were not heeded and he covertly supported Funi Daitoku at Iwakura and entered the Buddhist priesthood.

sen.j: 20年間隠遁した後、京都妙心寺の関山慧玄に参禅してその法を継ぎ、妙心寺2世となった。
sen.e: After 20 years of seclusion, he practiced Zen under Kanzan Egen of Myoshin-ji Temple in Kyoto and succeeded his teachings to become the 2nd head priest of Myoshin-ji Temple.
